meanings.definition: The act of making a loud, hollow sound when an object falls into water.
meanings.sent1: The kerplunking of the rock into the pond startled the ducks.
meanings.sent2: I heard the kerplunking of the acorns as they dropped from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The kerplunking of the water balloon made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The kerplunking of the coin into the wishing well echoed in the quiet park.
meanings.sent5: The kerplunking of the pebbles created a soothing rhythm by the stream.

meanings.definition: A sudden, heavy impact or drop.
meanings.sent1: The kerplunking of the hammer on the table made everyone jump.
meanings.sent2: The kerplunking of the box hitting the floor echoed through the room.
meanings.sent3: The kerplunking of the basketball hitting the ground startled the players.
meanings.sent4: The kerplunking of the book falling off the shelf broke the silence.
meanings.sent5: The kerplunking of the heavy rain on the roof kept me awake all night.

meanings.definition: To drop or fall suddenly with a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally kerplunked the glass off the table.
meanings.sent2: The apples kerplunked into the basket as they were picked.
meanings.sent3: The cat kerplunked from the tree branch and landed on its feet.
meanings.sent4: The rain kerplunked on the window, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The coins kerplunked into the piggy bank one by one.
